content.webTitle: The new Liberal Democrat front bench

fields.headline: The new Liberal Democrat front bench
fields.bodyText: Leader: Charles Kennedy Deputy leader and Cabinet Office spokesman: Alan Beith Treasury spokesman: Matthew Taylor Deputy Treasury spokesman: David Laws MP Foreign affairs spokesman: Menzies Campbell International development spokeswoman:Jenny Tonge Home affairs spokesman: Simon Hughes Party chairman: Mark Oaten Education and skills spokesman: Phil Willis Health spokesman:Evan Harris Transport spokesman: Don Foster Spokesman on the Office of the Deputy Prime Minister: Edward Davey Environment spokesman: Norman Baker Rural affairs and food spokesperson: Andrew George Work and pensions spokesman: Steve Webb Defence spokesman: Paul Keetch Trade and industry spokesman: Vince Cable Scotland: John Thurso Wales and Northern Ireland: Lembit Opik Culture, media and sport: Nick Harvey House of Commons: Paul Tyler Chief whip: Andrew Stunell Spokesperson on older people: Paul Burstow Spokesperson on women: Sandra Gidley Chairman of Scottish campaigns: Mike Moore House of Lords: Baroness Williams Chief whip in the Lords: Lord Roper Party president: Lord Dholakia Chair of the campaigns and communications committee: Lord Razzall · Archy Kirkwood MP attends shadow cabinet in his own capacity. · Mark Oaten has been unanimously re-elected as chair of the parliamentary party.
